00030 int test_print_instruction(int sw)
00031 {
00032   if (sw==TEST_SQWAVE){
00033     std::cout<<"You are testing DAQ with square wave."<<std::endl;
00034     std::cout<<"This test assumes that the 1 kHz square wave comes into channel 0 with a 100 us duration."<<std::endl;
00035 //    std::cout<<"Press enter when it is ready."<<std::endl;
00036   }
00037 //  std::cin.get();
00038   return 0;
00039 }

00042 
00043  int load_parameter(const std::string file_name)
00044  {
00045 
00046    //NetCDF/CDL parameter file object (i.e. parameter class)
00047    CParameterNetCDF fp;
00048 
00050    int error=fp.loadFile((char *)file_name.c_str());
00051    if(error){std::cerr<<"loadFile return "<< error <<std::endl;return error;}
00052 
00054    //prepare to load parameters as the attribute of "test"
00056    float process;
00057    std::string process_name="test";
00058    if((error=fp.loadVar(process,&process_name))){std::cerr<<"Error: process variable \""<<process_name<<"\" can not be loaded (return value is "<<error<<")\n";return error;}
00059 
00061    // load parameters as process attributes
00063    fp.loadAttribute("frequency",reference_frequency);
00064    fp.loadAttribute("duty_cycle",reference_DC);
00065    fp.loadAttribute("tolerance",reference_tolerance);
00066    int param;
00067    fp.loadAttribute("DCfreq",param);
00068    DCfrequency =(param==1);
00069    fp.loadAttribute("filter",param);
00070    gaussian_filter =(param==1);
00071 
00072    return 0;
00073   }

00080 
00095   template <typename T> int detect_edges(cimg_library::CImg<float> data, 
00096                                          cimg_library::CImg<int> &raisingedges,
00097                                          cimg_library::CImg<int> &fallingedges,
00098                                          T threshold, int verbose,bool borders)
00099 {
00100   cimg_library::CImg<int>     clean          = data.get_threshold(threshold);
00101   cimg_library::CImgList<int> gcleanlist;
00102   //cimg_library::CImg<int> clean;
00103   cimg_library::CImg<int> clean_gradient;
00104     
00105   int raising_count = 0;
00106   int falling_count = 0;
00107 
00108   // GRADIENT
00109   gcleanlist= clean.get_gradient("x",1);
00110 
00111   if(verbose >= 3)
00112     {
00113       data.display_graph("raw data"); 
00114       clean.display_graph("clean data");   
00115     }
00116   //gcleanlist[0].display_graph("clean_gradient"); 
00117   //raisingedges.assign(clean_gradient.width());
00118   //fallingedges.assign(clean_gradient.width());
00119   
00120   //clean gradient
00121   clean_gradient = gcleanlist(0);
00122   
00123   //detect raising and falling edges
00124   raisingedges.assign(clean_gradient.width());
00125   fallingedges.assign(clean_gradient.width());
00126 
00127   cimg_forX(clean_gradient,s){
00128 
00129   //PR(clean.size()); 
00130 
00131     if(clean_gradient(s)==1){
00132       raisingedges(raising_count)=s;
00133       raising_count++;
00134     }
00135 
00136     if(clean_gradient(s)==-1){
00137       fallingedges(falling_count)=s;
00138       falling_count++;
00139     }
00140   }//sample loop
00141  //PR(clean.size()); 
00142 
00143   raisingedges.crop(0,raising_count-1);
00144   fallingedges.crop(0,falling_count-1);
00145 
00146   //Clean borders
00147   if(borders)
00148   { //suppression if falling before raising
00149     if(fallingedges(0)<raisingedges[0]) fallingedges.crop(1,(fallingedges.size()-1));
00150     //crop if raising different falling
00151     if(raisingedges.size()!=fallingedges.size()) raisingedges.crop(0,(fallingedges.size()-2));
00152   }//clean border
00153 
00154 return 0;
00155 }

00160 
00161 template <typename T> int duration_samples ( cimg_library::CImg<T> raisingedges,cimg_library::CImg<T> fallingedges,cimg_library::CImg<T> &duration_up,
00162 CImg<T> &duration_down)
00163 {
00164   // calculation of duration up 
00165   duration_up.assign(raisingedges.width());
00166   duration_up=fallingedges-raisingedges;
00167   //calculation of duration down
00168   duration_down.assign(raisingedges.width()-1);
00169   cimg_forX(duration_down,c) duration_down(c)=raisingedges(c+1)-fallingedges(c);
00170 //PR(duration_down(0));
00171 
00172 return 0;
00173 }
00174 
00175 
00182 template <typename Tin,typename Tout> int duration_sampletotime (cimg_library::CImg<Tin> duration_up,int frequence_acqui,cimg_library::CImg<Tout> &duration_up_time)
00183 {
00184   duration_up_time.assign(duration_up.width());
00185   Tout scaling=1/(Tout)frequence_acqui;
00186   duration_up_time=duration_up*scaling;
00187   return 0;
00188 }

00200 template <typename T> int period (cimg_library::CImg<T> uporDC,cimg_library::CImg<T> duration_down_time, cimg_library::CImg<T> &TorF)
00201 {
00202 TorF.assign(duration_down_time.width());
00203 TorF= uporDC + duration_down_time;
00204 
00205 return 0;
00206 }

00211 
00219 template <typename T> int compute_duty_cycle(cimg_library::CImg<T> &uporDC,cimg_library::CImg<T> &period)
00220 { 
00221   uporDC.assign(period.width());
00222   cimg_forX(uporDC,x) uporDC(x)/=period(x);
00223   return 0;
00224 }

00229 
00235 template <typename T> int compute_frequence_cycle(cimg_library::CImg<T> DC,cimg_library::CImg<T> &TorF)
00236 {
00237   TorF.assign(DC.width());
00238   cimg_forX(TorF,x) TorF(x)= 1/TorF(x);
00239   return 0;
00240 }

00245 
00251 template <typename T> int compute_filter_data(cimg_library::CImg<T> data,cimg_library::CImg<T> &data_filter)
00252 
00253 { 
00254 // calcul du min,max,mean et rms 
00255   
00256   float data_moy;
00257   float data_min;
00258   float data_max; 
00259   float data_rms;
00260 
00261   data_min= data.min();
00262   data_max= data.max();
00263   data_moy=data.mean();
00264   data_rms= std::sqrt(data.variance());
00265 
00266 // filtre des valeurs aberrantes
00267   
00268   float low_data;
00269   int data_filter_count;
00270   float high_data;
00271   
00272   data_filter=data;
00273   data_filter.assign(data.width());
00274   data_filter_count=0;
00275   low_data=data_moy - (3 * data_rms);
00276   high_data=data_moy + (3 * data_rms);
00277   cimg_forX(data,x)
00278   {
00279 
00280     if ((data(x)> low_data) && (data(x)< high_data))
00281 
00282  
00283     { 
00284  
00285      data_filter(data_filter_count)=data(x);
00286      data_filter_count++;
00287   
00288     }
00289   }//for x
00290 //PR(data_filter_count);
00291   data_filter.resize(data_filter_count);
00292 
00293   return 0;
00294 }

00299 
00305 template <typename T> int compute_filter_error(cimg_library::CImg<T> &duration_up,cimg_library::CImg<T> &raisingedges,cimg_library::CImg<T> &data_error_filter)
00306 { 
00307   data_error_filter.assign(duration_up.width());
00308   float data_mean_up=duration_up.mean();
00309   float data_rms_up=std::sqrt(duration_up.variance());
00310   int j=0;
00311   cimg_forX(duration_up,i)
00312   {
00313 
00314 if( (duration_up(i)< (data_mean_up-3 * data_rms_up)) || (duration_up(i) > (data_mean_up+ 3 * data_rms_up)) )
00315 
00316 {
00317 data_error_filter(j)=raisingedges(i);
00318 j++;
00319 }
00320   }//duration_up loop
00321 data_error_filter.crop(0,j-1);
00322   
00323 data_error_filter.print("error filter");
00324 
00325 return 0;
00326 }

00331 
00337 template <typename T> int compute_data_histogram ( cimg_library::CImg<T> data,T frequence_acqui,cimg_library::CImg<T> &data_histogram)  
00338 {  
00339    int nb_classes;
00340    T data_min;
00341    T data_max;
00342   
00343 
00344 //data.print("data");
00345   data_min= data.min();
00346   data_max= data.max();
00347   nb_classes=(int)std::ceil((data_max-data_min)*frequence_acqui+1);
00348   
00349         
00350   PR(nb_classes);
00351   //  data_histogram.assign(data.width());
00352   PR(data_max);
00353   PR(frequence_acqui);
00354   T tmp=data_max+1/frequence_acqui;
00355   PR(tmp);
00356   data_histogram=data.get_histogram(nb_classes,data_min,tmp);
00357 //data_histogram.print("histogram");
00358   return 0;
00359 }

00370 template <typename T> int test_signal (cimg_library::CImg<T> data, int frequence_acqui,bool filter, bool DCfreq,int display,T reference_frequency,T reference_DC, T reference_tolerance)
00371 {
00372   cimg_library::CImg<T> TorF;
00373   cimg_library::CImg<int> duration_up;
00374   cimg_library::CImg<int> duration_down;
00375   cimg_library::CImg<T> uporDC;
00376   cimg_library::CImg<int> duration_down_time;
00377   cimg_library::CImg<int> period_samples;
00378   cimg_library::CImg<int> fallingedges;
00379   cimg_library::CImg<int> raisingedges;
00380   cimg_library::CImg<T> data_histogram;
00381   float data_moy;
00382   float data_rms;
00383   cimg_library::CImg<int> data_error_filter;
00384   cimg_library::CImg<int> data_error_filter_up;
00385   cimg_library::CImg<int> data_error_filter_down;
00386   //cimg_library::CImg<T> data_filter;
00387   T reference_duration_up;
00388   T reference_period;

00390   float maxY_histo;
00391   float maxX;
00392   cimg_library::CImg<float> stats_histo;
00393 
00394   reference_duration_up = (reference_DC)/(reference_frequency);
00395   reference_period = 1.0/reference_frequency;
00396 
00397 
00398   //in sample
00399   detect_edges(data,raisingedges,fallingedges,2.5f,display,true);
00400   duration_samples(raisingedges,fallingedges,duration_up,duration_down);
00401   duration_up.print("duration_up");
00402   duration_down.print("duration_down");
00403   period(duration_up,duration_down,period_samples);
00404   period_samples.print("period_samples");
00405   //in time
00406   duration_sampletotime(period_samples,frequence_acqui,TorF);
00407   TorF.print("TorF");
00408   duration_sampletotime(duration_down,frequence_acqui,duration_down_time);
00409   duration_down_time.print("duration_down_time");
00410   duration_sampletotime(duration_up,frequence_acqui,uporDC);
00411   uporDC.print("uporDC");
00412 
00413 if (DCfreq)
00414 {
00415   compute_duty_cycle(uporDC,TorF);
00416   compute_frequence_cycle(uporDC,TorF);
00417 }
00418 
00419 //filter and histogram if uporDC=duration up in time or duty cycle
00420 if(filter) compute_filter_data(uporDC,uporDC);
00421 uporDC.print("uporDC_filter");
00423 if (!DCfreq) compute_data_histogram (uporDC,(T)frequence_acqui,data_histogram);//T
00424 else compute_data_histogram (uporDC,reference_frequency/(T)frequence_acqui,data_histogram);//DC
00425 data_histogram.print("uporDC_histogram");
00426 
00427 if (display >= 1)
00428 {
00429   T min=uporDC.min();
00430   T max=uporDC.max();
00431 
00432 
00433   if(DCfreq)
00434   {
00435     data_histogram.display_graph("histogram_DC",3,1,"Duty cycle",min,max+reference_frequency/(T)frequence_acqui,"Duty cycle count");
00436     //data_histogram.display_graph("histogram_DC",3,1,"Duty cycle",0,1,"Duty cycle count");
00437 
00438   }
00439   else
00440   {
00441     data_histogram.display_graph("duration up in time ",3,1,"duration up",min,max+1/(T)frequence_acqui,"up count");
00442   }
00443 
00444 }// end if display
00445 else 
00446 {
00447 
00448   if(DCfreq) data_histogram.print("histogram_DC");
00449   else data_histogram.print("duration up");
00450 
00451 return 0;
00452 }// end if no display(print)
00453 
00454 
00455 //filter and histogram if TorF=frequency or period
00456 if (filter) compute_filter_data(TorF,TorF);
00457 TorF.print("TorF_filter");
00458 compute_filter_error(duration_up,raisingedges,data_error_filter_up);
00459 compute_filter_error(duration_down,fallingedges,data_error_filter_down);
00460 data_error_filter.assign(data_error_filter_up.width()+data_error_filter_down.width());
00461 data_error_filter.draw_image(0,data_error_filter_up);
00462 data_error_filter.draw_image(data_error_filter_up.width(),data_error_filter_down);
00463 data_error_filter.sort();
00464 
00465  if(display >= 2)
00466    {
00467      data_error_filter_up.display_graph("error place up",1,1,"error index",0,0,"sample index");
00468      data_error_filter_down.display_graph("error place down",1,1,"error index",0,0,"sample index");
00469      data_error_filter.display_graph("error place up+down",1,1,"error index",0,0,"sample index");
00470    }
00471 
00473 if(!DCfreq) compute_data_histogram(TorF,(T)frequence_acqui,data_histogram);//T
00474 else        compute_data_histogram(TorF,data.width()/(T)frequence_acqui,data_histogram);//F
00475 
00476 data_histogram.print("TorF_histogram");
00477 
00478 if (display >= 1)
00479 {
00480   if(DCfreq)data_histogram.display_graph("histogram_frequence",3,1,"frequence",TorF.min(),TorF.max()+frequence_acqui/(T)data.width(),"frequence count");
00481   else data_histogram.display_graph("period",3,1,"period",TorF.min(),TorF.max(),"period count");
00482 }//end if display
00483 else
00484 
00485 {
00486 
00487   if (DCfreq)data_histogram.print("frequence");
00488   else data_histogram.print("period");
00489 
00490 }//end if no display(print)
00491  //test with the reference data
00492  std::cout<<"############################ "<< std::endl;
00493  std::cout<<"#####   BEGIN OF TEST  ##### "<< std::endl;
00494  std::cout<<"############################ "<< std::endl;
